elements.title: Eretnid dynasty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Eretnid dynasty that ruled central and eastern Anatolia during the 14th century was founded by Eretna (coin pictured), an Ilkhanid officer of Uyghur origin?

elements.title: Krisztofer Mészáros (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2021 Krisztofer Mészáros became the first Hungarian male gymnast in 22 years to qualify for a World Artistic Gymnastics Championships all-around final?

elements.title: Maggio di Accettura (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Maggio di Accettura, a festival in Italy dedicated to the Christian martyr Saint Julian, might have pagan origins or be linked to Langobard history?

elements.title: Don Tait (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that WFMT classical music radio host Don Tait owned such a large collection of recordings that he had to buy a house and have its floor reinforced to accommodate the weight?

elements.title: a silver mine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some Confederate bullets were sourced from a silver mine?

elements.title: portraying the role of a bargirl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rachelle Ann Go debuted in the West End and Broadway revivals of Miss Saigon portraying the role of a bargirl?

elements.title: Hiss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nicki Minaj reacted to Megan Thee Stallion's "Hiss" with a 3,100-character Twitter diatribe and a diss track?

elements.title: Darius Durham (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a San Diego State coach called Darius Durham "the best high school guy we've ever signed"?

elements.title: Bangiales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bangiales, an order of red algae, contains both the oldest-known sexually reproducing organism and the seaweed used to make sushi wrappers?
